description: From Middle English butter-melke, equivalent to butter +‎ milk. Compare German Low German Bottermelk (“buttermilk”), German Buttermilch (“buttermilk”).

entries.meaning: The liquid left over after producing butter from full cream milk by the churning process, also called traditional buttermilk.
Cultured buttermilk, a fermented dairy product produced from cow's milk, with a characteristically sour taste.
